required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment and Tracking of Long-term Alefacept Safety
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment and Tracking of Long-term Alefacept (LFA-3/IgG1 Fusion Protein) Safety (ATLAS)

brief_summary.textblock: Subjects exposed to alefacept are to be enrolled. Subjects will be contacted every 6 months to gather general health information.

detailed_description.textblock: There are no study-mandated tests, visits or clinical interventions after the 1st (enrolling) visit. After the patient is enrolled in the study, they will be contacted every 6 months to complete structured telephone interviews conducted by the ATLAS Study Center.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The Sponsor has made a decision, driven by business needs, to cease promotion, manufacturing, distribution and sales of Amevive

primary_outcome.measure: To measure the rates of non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) and infections that require hospitalization occurring in psoriasis patients treated with alefacept
primary_outcome.time_frame: At six month intervals for five years

secondary_outcome.measure: To estimate the rates of lung cancer, breast cancer (female), prostate cancer, colorectal cancer, melanoma and active tuberculosis within a population of patients with psoriasis treated with alefacept.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At six month intervals for five years

arm_group.description: Patients treated with alefacept for chronic plaque psoriasis

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated with alefacept for chronic plaque psoriasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Psoriasis patients who are prescribed alefacept consistent with product labeling are eligible for enrollment.
